text.title: Adéla Pollertová
text.head: Adéla Pollertová
text.p: Adéla Pollertová (born in Prague, Czech Republic) is a Czech ballet dancer and soloist of the National Theatre Ballet.
text.head: Education and career
text.p: Adéla Pollertová was born in Prague, Czech Republic in a sports family. From the early age, she practiced gymnastics but when she turned 15 she decided to attend the Prague Dance Conservatory,[1] and graduated from it within less than five years. After graduating, she went to Hamburg where at the age of 19 she joined Hamburg Ballet of John Neumeier and became its soloist with whom she worked from 1995 to 2004.[2][3]
text.head: Career
Early career
text.p: Before joining Hamburg Ballet, Pollertová performed lead roles such as Clara in The Nutcracker, Lisa in Wary In Vain and the solo in Balanchine's Serenade.[2][3]
text.head: Hamburg Ballet
text.p: During her service at the Hamburg Ballet, she performed such roles as the Alien Princess in A Cinderella Story, Princess Florina in The Sleeping Beauty, Maria in The Nutcracker, Helen in A Midsummer Night's Dream, Tamara Karsavina and Matilda Ksheshinska in Nijinsky (which she also co-choreographed), Olympia in La Dame aux Camélias, Phoebe in As You Like It, the Wedding Couple and Zulma in Giselle, Princess Claire in Illusion – Like Swan Lake, and Juliet from the troupe in Romeo and Juliet.[3][2]

Adéla Pollertová is also known for hear appearances in Mats Ek's versions of She Was Black and The Sleeping Beauty as well as Natalia Makarova's La Bayadère where she danced as one of the solo shadows. She also performed a solo in Christopher Wheeldon's VIII and danced in Bach Suite 2 and Gustav Mahler's Symphony No. 3 and Symphony No. 5. She also had minor appearances in Bartók Bilder, Getting Closer, Messiah, and Vaslaw before joining National Theatre Ballet for the 2004/2005 season.[3][2]
text.head: National Theatre Ballet
text.p: Adéla Pollertová joined the National Theatre Ballet after becoming friends with Petr Zuska, who was the theatre director at the time.[4] For him, she performed as the Wedding Couple and Giselle in Giselle and Tarantella and Spanish dancer in Swan Lake. She also did lead roles such as Clara in Youri Vámos's The Nutcracker - A Christmas Carol, a Queen in The Sleeping Beauty, Juliet in Romeo and Juliet, Olga in John Cranko's ballet Onegin, Sylph in August Bournonville's La Sylphide, and as Goldilocks in Jan Kodet's children's ballet of the same name.[3][2]
She also was a winner for Czech Republic in the Olympic Games and worked as an opera singer prior to her retirement in 2018.[5]
text.head: Awards
text.p: In 1994 Pollertová was a recipient of the bronze medal for the best choreographic work of I Feel Good in Jackson, Mississippi and the same year became a winner of the National Ballet Competition in Brno. In 1999 she was awarded Wilhelm Oberdörffer Prize and in 2006 became a recipient of the Thalia Award "for her brilliant rendition of Juliet in the ballet Romeo and Juliet".[3][2]
